column4: hey all, I'm having some trouble installing ubuntu on my laptop, when I try to install it it halts and drops me into a terminal Busy Box 1.3 (initramfs)
I think it can't find a filesystem, I previously installed OpenSuse, then deleted the partition, I think my .mbr is gone.
can I restore that with my Vista CD?
its looking for the suse partition namely /boot/grub on suse partiion id just use ubuntu to rewrite the mbr pointing to the ub part
I can't do that since I can't get it installed, I guess I'll have to make a GRUB rescue disk?
it depends on what you want to do. are you looking to get rid of all linux and just back to windows?
I'm trying to install ubuntu on my laptop, I'm on my desktop machine now
which has Vista on it and previously OpenSuse, I deleted the OpenSuse partition
what is the prob with installer? just blank screen or what
it drops me into a terminal Busy Box 1.3 (initramfs)
easisest thing may be to use alternate install cd available on ubuntu.com
it says it can't access tty

thats a fairly common error from what ive seen on ubuntuforums.org. id consider the alt cd or maybe even debian or the gutsy installer. some links: http://www.utheguru.com/solution-ubuntu-linux-binsh-cant-access-tty-job-control-mode-off-error https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.20/+bug/78380
